avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is in general low in the morning but will increase to moderate during the course of the day in areas with high amounts of snow on sunny slopes. Loose wet-snow avalanches which could be triggered in extremly steep, rocky slopes can be sponaneously triggered. Thes avalanches are mostly small to medium sized.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The avalanche danger is increasing during the course of the day.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snow base has settled and is predominantly stable. The snow surface is mostly icy or with hoar. On top of that is a powder-like layer in high altitudes. The surface in sunny areas gets quickly moist and wet. During the night the snow cover can cool down and solidify.

tendency.highlights: The sunny high-pressure system weather will last throughout the whole week. The avalanche danger will decrease.

weatherForecast.comment: The upcoming days will be dominated by a high-pressure system and dry air masses in the eastern Alps. On Tuesday, after a cool night sunny mountain weather, only short-term cloudy is called. The sunny weather can be slightly clouded by high veil clouds. Weak southern winds. Temperatures at noon are around 1 to 2 degrees in 2.000 m.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is in general low. Nevertheless small loose wet-snow avalanches are possible during the course of the day. These are coming predominantly from extremly steep, rocky slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Low avalanche danger. Caution: small spontaneous wet-snow avalanches are possible!

snowpackStructure.comment: The snow base has settled and is predominantly stable. The snow surface is mostly icy or with hoar. The surface in sunny areas gets quickly moist and wet.

tendency.highlights: The sunny high-pressure system weather will last throughout the whole week. The avalanche danger will stay low.

weatherForecast.comment: The upcoming days will be dominated by a high-pressure system and dry air masses in the eastern Alps. On Tuesday, after a cool night sunny mountain weather, only short-term cloudy is called. The sunny weather can be slightly clouded by high veil clouds. Weak southern winds. Temperatures at noon are around 1 to 2 degrees in 2.000 m.

customData.generalHeadline: Excellent Mountain weather - avalanche danger is increasing during the course of the day.
